title: 'To be the man, you’ve got to beat the man': Maro Itoje predicts England will seize moment against New Zealand
text:
The teeming skies above the International Stadium in Yokohama could do nothing to dampen the enthusiasm of the England team as they splashed their way on to the field for their eve-of-match captain’s run, whooping and hollering as if they were schoolboys out for a lark, a sure sign of their blissful sense of togetherness as they prepare to ‘go get the All Blacks.’

A study in body language can only take you so far. Dress rehearsals can deceive as much as inform before the curtain goes up. But there was simply no escaping the air of expectancy flowing through this England squad, a storm...
description: The teeming skies above the International Stadium in Yokohama could do nothing to dampen the enthusiasm of the England team as they splashed their way on to the field for their eve-of-match captain’s run, whooping and hollering as if they were schoolboys out for a lark, a sure sign of their blissful sense of togetherness as they prepare to ‘go get the All Blacks.
